ca.mcgill.ecse211.finalproject.phase2

Class ColorPoller

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.finalproject.phase2.ColorPoller
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class ColorPoller
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Class which takes care of color sensor polling, signal filtering as well as odometry correction using the color sensors
    Author:
    yp, holmsi

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static java.lang.Thread leftColorThread
      leftColorThread
      private static int leftCounter
      safety net counter for no line detection on the left
      private static boolean leftLineDetected
      whether or not the left sensor is currently detecting a black line
      static ColorSampler leftSampler
      left light Sampler
      private static java.lang.Thread rightColorThread
      RightColorThread
      private static int rightCounter
      safety net counter for no line detection on the right
      private static boolean rightLineDetected
      whether or not the right sensor is currently detecting a black line
      static ColorSampler rightSampler
      right light Sampler
      private static boolean wait
      boolean to make the thread wait while turning

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ColorPoller()
      constructor, starts both left and right threads

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private static void correctX(double currX, double updatedTheta)
      Reset the X position based on what tile the robot thinks it is on, if the robot is less than half a tile away from its current position in each direction, correction is possible
      static void correctXYT()
      corrects the odometer according to the nearest black line using internal value readings
      private static void correctY(double currY, double updatedTheta)
      Reset the Y position based on what tile the robot thinks it is on, if the robot is less than half a tile away from its current position in each direction, correction is possible
      static void resetLineDetection()
      reset the line detect booleans to false
      void run()
      run method for the two color poller
      static void sleep()
      makes the color poller thread sleep while turning
      static void wake()
      wake the thread up after sleeping

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
